alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 9:52PM EDT until April 10 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... East Branch Delaware At Harvard affecting Delaware County. For the East Branch Delaware River...including Harvard...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Delaware At Harvard. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Low lying roads along the river from Downsville to East Branch begin to flood. At 11.0 feet, Harvard Road, Fox Lane and Harvard Cemetery Road become impassable in spots due to increasing river flooding. Camp cottage properties along Route 30 flood. At 12.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Between 12 and 15 feet, river flooding begins at the Oxbow Campground in Harvard. Significant backwater flooding from Baxter Brook is also likely. Residences along Harvard Road and Route 30 from Harvard to East Branch are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 12.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
